content.raw:
* -- other pr -- The "House 1" house type is extremely bright due to the increased global illumination which makes it basically completely white - any chance of either making its textures less bright or replacing those two houses of that type with different ones?

* The real-time factor for the walking world is 0.03 without the robot doing anything ... that's extremely low.

* -- fixed -- The standpipe collision model has a wrong offset.

* -- fixed -- The valve collision model is wrong - it's just a cylinder right now.

* The rubble is just white - this won't work for stereo.

* -- other pr -- The gas station wall is mainly white - unrealistic and won't work for stereo and visual odometry.

* -- fixed -- ``model.config`` file is missing for ``grass_plane``, ``platform_4``, ``vehicle_gate``, ``vrc_heightmap_2``, ``vrc_standpipe``, ``vrc_valve`` 

* [Gazebo issue 242](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issue/242/drc-terrain-texture-warps-when-gazebo) (which is wrongly marked as resolved) causes terrain to appear farther away than it is. For example the gazebo grid line marked by a red circle in this picture is at the same height as the terrain but due to the bug the terrain appears to be much farther beneath the line: http://i.imgur.com/9IiQdXL.png
This makes it impossible to use stereo for perceiving the terrain correctly.
content.html:
• -- other pr -- The "House 1" house type is extremely bright due to the increased global illumination which makes it basically completely white - any chance of either making its textures less bright or replacing those two houses of that type with different ones?

  • The real-time factor for the walking world is 0.03 without the robot doing anything ... that's extremely low.

  • -- fixed -- The standpipe collision model has a wrong offset.

  • -- fixed -- The valve collision model is wrong - it's just a cylinder right now.

  • The rubble is just white - this won't work for stereo.

  • -- other pr -- The gas station wall is mainly white - unrealistic and won't work for stereo and visual odometry.

  • -- fixed -- model.config file is missing for grass_plane, platform_4, vehicle_gate, vrc_heightmap_2, vrc_standpipe, vrc_valve

  • Gazebo issue 242 (which is wrongly marked as resolved) causes terrain to appear farther away than it is. For example the gazebo grid line marked by a red circle in this picture is at the same height as the terrain but due to the bug the terrain appears to be much farther beneath the line: http://i.imgur.com/9IiQdXL.png This makes it impossible to use stereo for perceiving the terrain correctly.

The primary point of this pull-request is to test real-time factors. Thanks for your data point, we'll continue testing and tweaking.

content.raw:
Thanks Nate.

Regarding the terrain: ignoring the fact that the normal map seems to be rendered incorrectly (i think .. normal maps shouldn't cause such a huge parallax but rather change the lighting/shadows on the model, but I might be wrong) the easiest fix would probably to allow height maps that don't have a normal map; as far as I remember the normal map is optional in Ogre.

Regarding the standpipe: At the moment the collision model covers the hole - does this mean that the threaded joint between standpipe and coupling gets created before the coupling touches the standpipe? If that's not the case then the collision model needs to be changed to model the hole, otherwise the robot won't be able to mount the hose.
content.html:
Thanks Nate.

Regarding the terrain: ignoring the fact that the normal map seems to be rendered incorrectly (i think .. normal maps shouldn't cause such a huge parallax but rather change the lighting/shadows on the model, but I might be wrong) the easiest fix would probably to allow height maps that don't have a normal map; as far as I remember the normal map is optional in Ogre.

Regarding the standpipe: At the moment the collision model covers the hole - does this mean that the threaded joint between standpipe and coupling gets created before the coupling touches the standpipe? If that's not the case then the collision model needs to be changed to model the hole, otherwise the robot won't be able to mount the hose.

content.raw:
More on terrain: I think there is more going on than a bad normal map. Initial tests show that ray sensors produce bad results, while physical objects (such as  ball rolling over the terrain) are more accurate but still not perfect. This is currently at the top of my list to resolve.

Standpipe: We are still developing the attachment mechanism for the hose to the standpipe. Our goal is to have the hose coupling go over the standpipe (we need to adjust the size of the standpipe accordingly). This will allow use to use simple shapes for the collision objects. The threaded joint will also be created automatically when the coupling end is aligned with the standpipe.
content.html:
More on terrain: I think there is more going on than a bad normal map. Initial tests show that ray sensors produce bad results, while physical objects (such as ball rolling over the terrain) are more accurate but still not perfect. This is currently at the top of my list to resolve.

Standpipe: We are still developing the attachment mechanism for the hose to the standpipe. Our goal is to have the hose coupling go over the standpipe (we need to adjust the size of the standpipe accordingly). This will allow use to use simple shapes for the collision objects. The threaded joint will also be created automatically when the coupling end is aligned with the standpipe.

content.raw:
It looks like the inertia values are incorrect for the components of the rubble pile. It's especially noticeable when a really long 2x4 has equal rotational inertia in all three directions.

Also, I noticed some rubble sliding around instead of being at rest. Perhaps we could add some velocity_decay to these elements.
content.html:
It looks like the inertia values are incorrect for the components of the rubble pile. It's especially noticeable when a really long 2x4 has equal rotational inertia in all three directions.

Also, I noticed some rubble sliding around instead of being at rest. Perhaps we could add some velocity_decay to these elements.

content.raw:
I just tried testing the LIDAR in world 2 (walking) and noticed that the real-time factor drops into a deep hole once subscribing to the LIDAR.

The measurements are with rubble disabled using ``gazebo_1.5`` running on a 3.6GHz quad-core:

* no sensors: 0.8
* no lidar, just stereo camera: 0.67 | gzserver: 184%, gzclient: 24%
* no camera, just lidar: 0.02  (rostopic hz still displays a framerate of 40Hz) | gzserver: 104%, gzclient: 24%


Like Steven I also noticed the rubble sliding along the ground ... in general the rubble really kills simulation. Without rubble I get 0.8, with rubble I get 0.03 real-time factor.


Something seems to have changed in general though with performance ... a few days ago (or even today I think) I got ~1.0 real-time factor with atlas.launch and now i'm only getting 0.8 ... only when I unlimit the update rate I get 1.2 (which also used to be higher I think).
Unlimiting the update rate also gives me a real-time factor of 0.1 instead of 0.02 when subscribing to the LIDAR.
content.html:
I just tried testing the LIDAR in world 2 (walking) and noticed that the real-time factor drops into a deep hole once subscribing to the LIDAR.

The measurements are with rubble disabled using gazebo_1.5 running on a 3.6GHz quad-core:

  • no sensors: 0.8
  • no lidar, just stereo camera: 0.67 | gzserver: 184%, gzclient: 24%
  • no camera, just lidar: 0.02 (rostopic hz still displays a framerate of 40Hz) | gzserver: 104%, gzclient: 24%

Like Steven I also noticed the rubble sliding along the ground ... in general the rubble really kills simulation. Without rubble I get 0.8, with rubble I get 0.03 real-time factor.

Something seems to have changed in general though with performance ... a few days ago (or even today I think) I got ~1.0 real-time factor with atlas.launch and now i'm only getting 0.8 ... only when I unlimit the update rate I get 1.2 (which also used to be higher I think). Unlimiting the update rate also gives me a real-time factor of 0.1 instead of 0.02 when subscribing to the LIDAR.

content.raw: @thomasko:  are you compiled in Release mode in `gazebo_1.5` branch?
content.html: @thomasko: are you compiled in Release mode in gazebo_1.5 branch?

@hsu : yep, RelWithDebInfo, the default. I just cleared and reinstalled everything and am back to ~0.97 for atlas.launch now, not sure what was wrong yesterday. I still get the same measurements for the walking world though - with the only difference that real-time factor doesn't go up to 0.1 anymore when i unbound the update rate but stays at 0.02 (which is the expected behaviour ... although not a very nice one ;) ).

The rt factor barely changes when i enable the lidar in the empty world, so I guess it's an issue of collision detection with height map?

content.raw:
Here's some issues from me. Tested with 1.4 - sorry but I can't work of the 1.5 branch! Please ignore if you think they are irrelevent for 1.5

Some images demoing issues:
http://people.csail.mit.edu/mfallon/vrc_worlds/
1. yellow/black replacement texture on several objects: start location, signs, cones etc. I think this been fixed in the 1.5 branch though.
2. lighting of robot is wrong in vrc1 and vrc2
3. texture on gates is much too small. As you can see in issues1.png the checker pattern cannot be seen.

Others:
4. vrc_task_1.world specfied:
        <model_name>golf_cart</model_name>
and this is included:
      <uri>model://polaris_ranger_ev</uri>

5. For me it works at 0.55 (with visual imagery output to ROS at 10Hz)
6. no laser data published - not sure why. Thomas doesnt seem to have that problem.

7. hose CoM is terrible, as is the bounding box and of course its actually has a fixed link. See image with Bounding box cube.

8. When I press play the rubble falls at a speed much lower than the Real Time fraction I'm seeing reported. Not sure whats going on there.

9. The 90degree turn of the road is very tight given the vehicle. Can the vehicle even do this turn? Can these turns be made to be smoother?

10. When I place the robot in the vehicle (via the placing hack), it cannot be driven - it seems to be locked at the starting x,y,z. But when the robot isnt in the car it can be driven with ros messages. this is not the same as in my own world.

Also what efforts will be made to randomise the runs? Will lengths, placements and angles be changed? (I noticed the rubble is random)

Some images demoing issues: http://people.csail.mit.edu/mfallon/vrc_worlds/ 1. yellow/black replacement texture on several objects: start location, signs, cones etc. I think this been fixed in the 1.5 branch though. 2. lighting of robot is wrong in vrc1 and vrc2 3. texture on gates is much too small.
